China: The Khitan chieftain Abaoji became emperor of the Liao dynasty. Zhu Wen deposed Ai and declared himself emperor of Later Liang. The princes Yang Wo and Wang Jian, who did not recognize Zhu Wen, became de facto independent, as did their states Wu and Former Shu, respectively. Zhu Wen created Qian Liu the prince of Wuyue. Zhu Wen created Ma Yin, the jiedushi of the Wu'an Circuit, prince of Chu.
Germany: Battle of Pressburg: An East Frankish army was wiped out by a Hungarian force at modern Bratislava during an attempted reconquest of Pannonia.
Indinesia:
Sumbing volcano erupted, according to Rukam inscription.
King Balitung created Mantyasih inscription containing the list of Medang kings, moved the capital from Mamrati to Poh Pitu, and expanded Prambanan temple.
Japan: Severe epidemics and extreme weather including floods and drought, popularly attributed to persecution of Sugawara no Michizane
Russia: Rus'-Byzantine War (907): Oleg led an army to the walls of Constantinople. Rus'-Byzantine War (907): A Rus'-Byzantine Treaty allowed Rus' merchants to enter the city under guard.
Slovenia: Slovene territory is settled by Magyars.
